Description.En: This module will guide students through the intersection of translation studies and cutting-edge technology, exploring how technological advancements like immersive media (e.g., virtual reality and augmented reality), artificial intelligence, robotics, and more are reshaping translation practices and the role of translators in a digital world. Students will gain a comprehensive understanding of the current trends and possible future developments of translation through the analysis of various case studies, both real and fictional. They will also learn how to critically reflect and reconstruct the mechanics, dynamics, and strategies behind future translations through individual and group exercises. Additionally, students will be encouraged to imagine and navigate a possible future of translation, preparing them to discover new potentials to tackle the challenges of translation in a rapidly changing world.

Title.En: Conceptualise and map the current trends and possible future developments of translation

NoteLiteral.En: The student understands different theoretical concepts derived from future oriented research and recognises the specific position of translation among them, in order to map the current trends and possible future developments of translation.

Title.En: Critically reflect on the current state of translation and produce imaginations of the future of tra

PrefLabel.En: evaluate data, information and digital content

NoteLiteral.En: The student is able to deploy simple methods inspired from speculative research in order to produce imaginations of the future of translation, translators and translation studies, and use them as a mean of critical reflection on the present

Title.En: Reconstruct the mechanics, dynamics, and strategies behind future translations

NoteLiteral.En: The student is able to engage different case studies, both real and fictional, in order to reconstruct the mechanics, dynamics, and strategies behind 	future translations.

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
Study format: This module will be held online for all ECIU students

Study schedule: This module will run every Wednesday from October 21st to December 5th, 2024, from 12:00 to 14:00 (Finnish time zone).

Assessment of the course: to pass the module, each student is expected to deliver: (1) a structured learning diary that reflects on the module's content and (2) assignments related to classroom activities. Further information for both will be provided during the first session of this module.
Explore our evolving mediascape through the lens of translation and its possible futures
"Futures of Translation" is designed to provide students with the fundamental knowledge needed to understand the dynamic field of translation.

This micromodule is open to all ECIU students who are interested in communication, digital media, translation studies or related fields.

Required documents: To enroll in this module, the student needs to submit a motivation letter in English (a statement explaining the reason why the student wishes to enroll in this module and how it aligns with his/her academic objectives or addresses his/her challenge topic)

Selection criteria: If the number of applicants exceeds the available seats in the module, students will be selected based on their motivation letter. The main criterion is that motivation letter clearly demonstrates a strong interest in the module.
